SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Horizon Enterprises relative to Vanguard Dynamics?
SRP.A: Horizon Enterprises is {below} Vanguard Dynamics in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total customer acquisition cost?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Vanguard Dynamics}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total customer acquisition cost?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Ironclad Ventures}.

VE.A: Vanguard Dynamics's customer acquisition cost in 2003 is {175.96} $.

NC.Q: Between 1997 and 2015, was the average total Customer Acquisition Cost higher or lower than between 1998 and 2004?
NC.A: The average total customer acquisition cost between 1997 and 2015 was {higher} than between 1998 and 2004.

NC.Q: Between 2004 and 2005, did the total Customer Acquisition Cost experience a larger or smaller change than between 2006 and 2011?
NC.A: The change in total customer acquisition cost between 2004 and 2005 was {smaller} than between 2006 and 2011.

NC.Q: Was the total Customer Acquisition Cost in 2007 higher or lower than in 2016?
NC.A: The total customer acquisition cost in 2007 was {lower} than in 2016.

NC.Q: Between 1997 and 2014, was the average total Customer Acquisition Cost higher or lower than between 2004 and 2014?
NC.A: The average total customer acquisition cost between 1997 and 2014 was {lower} than between 2004 and 2014.

MSR.A: {Vanguard Dynamics} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Ironclad Ventures, Horizon Enterprises, Vanguard Dynamics}.
